25.title: Alley Oop

27.title: Alley Oop
27.author: by V
notes: Summary: Leopold, King of Austria, has taken King Richard away, and Alley snatches the dress off the woman who turned him in.

28.title: Alley Oop
28.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley contemplates his next move, now that King Richard has been taken by the police.

29.title: Alley Oop
29.author: by V
notes: Summary: King Richard's men recognize Alley (as Blondel the Minstrel).

30.title: Alley Oop
30.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley tells Richard's band to stand by while he plays the vagabond minstrel again, looking in Austrian castles for the imprisoned King Richard.

31.title: Alley Oop
31.author: by V
notes: Summary: Back in the 20th century, Alley is angry that they didn't let him rescue King Richard, but history says a minstrel named Blondel made his release possible.

32.title: Alley Oop
32.author: by V
notes: Summary: In Wonmug's lab, people are wondering about an old piece of paper in an iron box that Alley dug up. He says somebody in a dream told him where to look for the box and that it was full of gold, but it wasn't.

33.title: Alley Oop
33.author: by V
notes: Summary: Oscar wants Alley to go back to sleep and dream up more details about the pirate gold his last dream told him about.

34.title: Alley Oop
34.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley wakes up with no new information about the gold, so Oscar gets a tray of "victuals" from the refrigerator to stimulate his dreaming.

35.title: Alley Oop
35.author: V
notes: Summary: Ooola has thrown the genie off his flying carpet.

36.title: Alley Oop
36.author: V
notes: Summary: The genie tells Alley he needs his magic turban (it's not really a carpet) back and Alley should help if he ever wants to see Ooola and Foozy again. Alley pulls the genie's beard.

37.title: Alley Oop
37.author: V
notes: Summary: The genie promises that the Queen of Sheba will be remembered in history, and that Alley will be tired from riding a camel.

38.title: Alley Oop
38.author: V
notes: Summary: The genie orders Kadookut, Sheba's brother, to prepare a caravan for the Queen.

39.title: Alley Oop
39.author: V
notes: Summary: Alley is king of a bunch of pumpkin heads, who throw their heads at him.

40.title: Alley Oop
40.author: V
notes: Summary: One pumpkin head brings another to register a complaint, but his complaint is he doesn't have a head, so he can't speak to complain. Alley switches the head from one to the other.

41.title: Alley Oop
41.author: V
notes: Summary: King Oop is advised to know which of his subjects are stupid, because they're the most dangerous.

42.title: Alley Oop
42.author: V
notes: Summary: Alley talks to a cat, that says it's a witch, and Alley doesn't care.

43.title: Alley Oop
43.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley is assigned to be MacBeth's bodyguard.

44.title: Alley Oop
44.author: by V
notes: Summary: Macbeth goes to the cave of the witches.

45.title: Alley Oop
45.author: by V
notes: Summary: The witches call up a ghost to speak to MacBeth.

46.title: Alley Oop
46.author: by V
notes: Summary: The ghost tells MacBeth to beware of MacDuff.

47.title: Alley Oop
47.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley insults Shakespeare's work, and Shakespeare calls him names.

48.title: Alley Oop
48.author: by V
notes: Summary: Back in the 20th century, Alley has had enough of Shakespeare and throws a volume of his works out the window.

49.title: Alley Oop
49.author: by V
notes: Summary: Oop's friends wonder why he's in such a bad mood.

50.title: Alley Oop
50.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley's friends convince themselves that they should take him to see a doctor. As they say he's "way below par," Alley is shown swinging his axe at a rock, golf-style.

51.title: Alley Oop
51.author: by V
notes: Summary: Doc and Ooola take Alley to see a doctor.

52.title: Alley Oop
52.author: by V
notes: Summary: The doctor is concerned about Alley's weight loss.

53.title: Alley Oop
53.author: by V
notes: Summary: The doctor tells Alley to quit smoking.

54.title: Alley Oop
54.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley has been given a few more years to live, if he quits smoking.

55.title: Alley Oop
55.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley buries his cigars to stop smoking.

56.title: Alley Oop
56.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley goes out with a shovel to dig up his box of cigars.

57.title: Alley Oop
57.author: by V
notes: Summary: A cigar tree has sprung up overnight on the spot where Alley buried his cigars.

58.title: Alley Oop
58.author: by V
notes: Summary: Four days off cigars, and now Alley has a stomach ache.

59.title: Alley Oop
59.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley knocks the baron over, takes his armor and sword, and poses in the new outfit for Eustace's approval.

60.title: Alley Oop
60.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley decides to replace Eustace with the baron's horse, but Eustace objects.

61.title: Alley Oop
61.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley tries to get Eustace to help him catch the baron's war horse but Eustace runs the other way.

62.title: Alley Oop
62.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley mentions food, and Eustace takes them toward the smell of barbecue.

63.title: Alley Oop
63.author: by V
notes: Summary: In England in 1066 A.D., Alley has knocked Oscar Boom off his horse.

64.title: Alley Oop
64.author: by V
notes: Summary: Doc is worried that Alley and Oscar will foul up the Norman Conquest.

65.title: Alley Oop
65.author: by V
notes: Summary: Alley Oop and the Saxons have been holding off the Normans and waiting for reinforcements, but then he finds that their messenger to London has been intercepted.

66.title: Alley Oop
66.author: by V
notes: Summary: Ooola wonders why Alley is defending a castle in the Battle of Hastings, and back in 1066 the defenders decide to leave.

67.title: Alley Oop
67.author: V
notes: Summary: Ooola wants to talk to Helen of Troy alone.

68.title: Alley Oop
68.author: V
68.series: July 13, 1955) "You're No More a Goddess Than I Am!"*
notes: Summary: Alone with Helen of Troy, Ooola gets down to business.

69.title: Alley Oop
69.author: V
69.series: July 14, 1955) "What Was So Special about Helen of Troy as to Start a Ten Years' War?"*
notes: Summary: Helen and Ooola are instantly at odds.

70.title: Alley Oop
70.author: V
70.series: July 15, 1955) "I Think I'd Better Cut This Short Before Ooola Makes a Liar out of Homer!"*

71.title: Alley Oop
71.author: V
71.series: Oct. 20, 1956) "It's Gonna Take More than One Can of Sardines t'keep ol' Mizoolie in the' Groove"*
notes: Summary: The fish-eating spook eats sardines, can and all.

72.title: Alley Oop
72.author: V
72.series: Oct. 22, 1956) "Why Not Go Catch 'im a Mess Out There in the Crick?"*
notes: Summary: Oscar has an idea how to keep the fish-eating spook happy.

73.title: Alley Oop
73.author: V
73.series: Oct. 23, 1956) "This Ain't No Place for a Spent Wing. An ol' Wooly Worm's th' Thing, You Watch!"*
notes: Summary: Mizoolie tries to criticize Oop's trout fishing technique.

74.title: Alley Oop
74.author: V
notes: Summary: Oop catches a fairly small trout, and the spook looks cross and grabs the rod to do it himself.

75.title: Alley Oop
75.author: V
75.series: Feb. 26, 1957) "An Exciting and Often Dangerous Business"*
notes: Summary: On the riverboat, Texas Jack East introduces himself, and they retire to the lounge where he learns that Oop is an explorer.

76.title: Alley Oop
76.author: V
76.series: Feb. 27, 1957) "I'll Just Up You a Thousand!"*
notes: Summary: Texas Jack starts a poker game, and Oop startles him.

77.title: Alley Oop
77.author: V
notes: Summary: Texas Jack seems to have a problem with Alley's aggressive poker style.

78.title: Alley Oop
78.author: V
78.series: Mar. 1, 1957) "You Think I Purposely Dealt You a Winning Hand?"*
notes: Summary: Oop thinks he's being set up as a greenhorn.

79.title: Alley Oop
79.author: V
79.series: Dec. 23, 1966) "She's Mad because I Didn't Get All Upset about th' King of Geewhiz Proposing to Her!"*
notes: Summary: Ooola doesn't like Oop's attitude.

80.title: Alley Oop
80.author: V
notes: Summary: Doc Wonmug is looking for Clank, the robot, who is doing his thing in the workshop.
Key word: Soldering.

81.title: Alley Oop
81.author: V

contents.author: V.T. Hamlin
contents.title: "Early one morning a million years ago" (12-5-1932 to 1-3 1933)

notes: Introductory text by Frank Stack, V.T. Hamlin, and Dave Graue.

82.title: Alley Oop
82.author: by Dave Graue.
82.series: Sept. 30, 1983) "You Might Hafta Use That Gun"*
notes: Summary: Looks like Alley and Jacques are in for an aerial dogfight in their LVG.

83.title: "Alley Oop" dailies Dec. 5, 1991 - Jan. 1, 1992
83.author: by Dave Graue, in Strip Adventure, no

84.title: Alley Oop
84.author: V

contents.author: V.T. Hamlin
contents.title: "Early one morning a million years ago" (12-5-1932 to 1-3 1933)

notes: Introductory text by Frank Stack, V.T. Hamlin, and Dave Graue.

85.title: Alley Oop
85.author: by Dave Graue.
85.series: July 29, 1999) "They're Still Out in the Jungle"*
notes: Summary: Neither Ooola nor Umpa is home, and it's getting dark.

86.title: Alley Oop
86.author: Graue-Bender.
notes: Summary: Search parties are out looking for Ooola and the queen.
Alley Oop in Spanish, from Diario las Americas (Miami), Feb. 3, 2000.

144.heading: Alleys.
144.title: "Chapuz√≥n"
144.author: Yolanda Vargas Dulc√©
notes: SUMMARY: Since Ricardo wants to be part of the gang the other boys arrange an initiation. First Ricardo has to carry each of them on his back like a horse. Then he has to let them throw him in the school's rooftop cistern. This is accomplished, but Ricardo can't get himself out of the cistern, sinks to the bottom, and drowns. Carlos pulls him out, and he seems dead, but he's not, quite. The teacher hears the commotion, takes Ricardo to the school doctor, and covers for the boys with the administration. At home Ricardo's mother insists that they move him to a new school. In a private talk with his father Ricardo explains everything, says he deserved his punishment, and wants to stay in the public school. The father understands because he wasn't always rich, and makes up a story to calm his wife. Things go better at school among the boys, and after a few days Ricardo dismisses his chauffeur so he can play baseball in an alley. Since it's a dirty place Ricardo takes his shoes off, and Mem√≠n guards them. Some bigger boys come along and want to use the area for their own game, and a fistfight starts. During the confusion a thief picks up Ricardo's shoes.

149.heading: Alleys.
149.title: "How Do You Hide a Superman?"
149.author: Cary Bates, writer ; Curt Swan, penciller ; Bob Oksner, inker ; Ben Oda, letterer ; Gene D'Angelo, colorist ; Julius Schwartz, editor
notes: Summary (by Mary Walker): Superman has crashed, is crippled and suffering from partial amnesia. Justin's problem is writer's block. He is called into an alley by Superman asking for help, and he thinks that he might be able to take the man to a nearby shelter when they see a craft manned by marauders from the future who have sapped Superman's powers. Justin leads him through the sewers. Evidently Superman also suffers from paranoia and turns on Justin who has found refuge for him in the Superman museum. Justin is saved from the fellow by the real Superman who reveals that the man is an escaped mental patient and the marauders were doctors. His mania is believing he is a reincarnation of Superman. He used advanced technology to make the simulation more believable.

161.title: Alley Oop
notes: Newspaper comic strip, originated by V. T. Hamlin, continued first by Dave Graue and later by Jack Bender. Includes both prehistoric adventure and time travel sequences. See also Oop's girlfriend Ooola
